article.headline: Massachusetts 69, La Salle 66 (OT)
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Maurice Maxwell scored 17 points and Jeff Viggiano made five crucial free throws in overtime as Massachusetts edged La Salle 69-66 on Saturday. Rashaun Freeman added 17 points, and Viggiano and Art Bowers 10 each for the Minutemen (14-9, 7-5 Atlantic 10), now assured of their first winning record since 1999-2000. Darnell Harris and Jermaine Hamas each had 18 points for La Salle (8-16, 4-9), while Steven Smith, the A-10's leading scorer at 21 points per game, was held to 12 points, hitting on only 2-of-11 from the field. La Salle took a 55-49 lead on a 3-point shot by Thomas with 5:30 left to play, but UMass ran off nine straight points, six by Freeman, to tie the score at 58-58. Another 3-point shot by Thomas with 59 seconds to go sent the game into overtime.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
